subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: Guy Carbonneau was fired as the coach of the struggling Montreal Canadiens, hockey’s most historic franchise that is in danger of missing the playoffs in its 100th season. The timing of Monday’s move was a bit surprising because the Canadiens were in the playoff race with 16 games left in the regular season. General Manager Bob Gainey, who preceded Carbonneau as the coach three years ago, will return behind the bench when Montreal plays Edmonton at home Tuesday.
